hero.core_tension: Deciding when to deploy a two‑phase holiday tempo: a targeted 'early access' loyalty launch two weeks before last year vs. a public flagship weekend — framed as a choice to capture early high‑value shoppers while measuring incremental footfall and per‑visit AOV across an 8‑week test.
hero.setting: Studio backlot styled as a minimalist flagship corner: matte concrete floor, neutral painted backdrop, a draped window-frame mockup and a collapsible pop‑up maquette on a workbench.
hero.persona: Store operations lead (operator) in a tailored coat and a studio producer in a casual blazer — both collaborative, hands‑on, deliberate.
hero.action: Three‑quarter angle: subjects lean over a tabletop playbook of printed loyalty cards, tiered paper discount chips and tagged SKU swatches; one points while the other gestures toward a stacked maquette.
hero.urgency_symbol: Converging light bands and layered translucent schedule cards — staggered, slightly offset — to imply compressed windows and staged release without a literal clock.
props: tiered paper discount chips and physical tag samples
glass counters or bead tokens representing footfall
hero.lighting: Polished editorial lighting with confident highlights, key rim light on faces and props, soft directional fill, and ample clean negative space.
hero.mood: Precise, anticipatory and collaborative — calm confidence under purposeful timing pressure.
hero.alt: Two people — a store operations lead and a studio producer — lean over a tabletop in a minimalist studio, pointing at printed loyalty cards, discount chips and a small pop‑up maquette under polished editorial lighting that casts confident highlights; layered translucent schedule cards and converging light bands imply a compressed two‑phase holiday timing decision.

signal_map.structure: Concentric rings and radial arcs with an underlying lattice of paths — outer rings for early windows, inner rings for flagship weekends; intersecting arcs mark tactical shifts.
elements: stacked paper chips for discount tiers and margin bands
signal_map.motion: Soft arcing flows that move from the outer ring inward in staggered pulses (weekly cadence), with occasional diverging paths to show split tests and phased discounts.
signal_map.palette: Warm gold and deep ochre accents for flagship/high‑value windows; cool steel, frosted blue and matte graphite for early tests and market signals; materials include matte paper, brushed brass and frosted glass.
signal_map.alt: A tabletop signal map made of concentric rings, radial arcs and a lattice of paths: brass tokens mark weekly footfall, stacked paper chips indicate discount tiers, and frosted discs show loyalty segments; arcing flows lead from outer 'early' rings toward an inner flagship node under clean editorial light.

case_studies.scene: Retail ops test bench staged near a storefront mockup: wide three‑quarter view with depth, matte wood table in foreground and a painted storefront elevation in background.
case_studies.moment: Capturing the decision to start an 'early access' loyalty window two weeks before last year's campaign and instrument an 8‑week test to measure incremental footfall and AOV.
case_studies.persona: Operator (store district manager) and studio analyst leaning over weekly report cards and footfall bead counters, one marking a physical timeline with a felt tip.
props: stacked weekly report cards (printed) with marginalia
glass bead counters for footfall cohorts
tape measure or simple ruler as a timing metaphor
case_studies.lighting: Polished editorial key light off‑axis, subtle backlight to separate subjects, clean negative space around the table.
case_studies.mood: Measured, data‑driven anticipation — focused testing under mild time pressure.
case_studies.alt: A district manager and studio analyst at a test bench near a storefront mockup examine printed weekly report cards and glass bead counters; one annotates a timeline with a pen while polished editorial lighting highlights the materials, implying an 8‑week early‑access test to measure footfall and AOV.

case_studies.scene: Close, low‑angle composition over a matte tabletop showing discount‑tier artifacts arranged in a graded fan toward a flagship sample window.
case_studies.moment: Deciding a phased discount schedule: smaller public discounts early with deeper loyalty or in‑store exclusives reserved for flagship weekends to protect margin and track week‑over‑week elasticity.
case_studies.persona: Merch and pricing lead (operator) and a creative producer aligning discount chips and margin bands physically on the table.
props: brass margin rulers or labeled margin tiles
case_studies.lighting: Crisp editorial overhead rim with confident highlights on paper edges and brass surfaces, plentiful negative space to isolate the graded chips.
case_studies.mood: Strategic, cautious confidence focused on preserving margin through phased tactics.
case_studies.alt: Low‑angle close shot of a merch lead and creative producer arranging graded paper discount chips and brass margin tiles on a matte table; crisp editorial lighting emphasizes the chips' edges, symbolizing a phased discount schedule to balance conversion and margin.

case_studies.scene: Studio corner with a civic co‑brand mockup: medium shot showing a folded banner, community poster board and a small wooden event kiosk model on a neutral backdrop.
case_studies.moment: Proposing a short‑term co‑branded civic/flagship activation with a local partner and city agency for the holiday window, to measure footfall and local media resonance across 6–8 weeks.
case_studies.persona: Partnership operator and studio strategist exchanging notes over the event kiosk model, one arranging press‑style sample postcards.
props: community poster board with pinned media clippings (mocked)
case_studies.lighting: Directional editorial side‑light with warm golden accent on the co‑brand banner, balanced fill to keep background tonally quiet.
case_studies.mood: Civic‑minded, collaborative, slightly ceremonial with purposeful timing.
case_studies.alt: A partnership operator and studio strategist review a wooden event kiosk maquette, folded co‑brand banner and postcard proofs under warm side light; the scene suggests planning a short‑term civic co‑branded activation to be measured over a 6–8 week holiday window.

case_studies.scene: Pop‑up planning table shot: overhead 45° angle showing a district map, pop‑up footprint mockups and social capture samples laid out on textured paper.
case_studies.moment: Planning a 10–14 day co‑branded pop‑up in a targeted flagship district to track visit‑to‑purchase conversion, email capture and social impressions during the run.
case_studies.persona: Field operator and studio events lead pinning location tags on the map and aligning pop‑up footprint pieces.
props: textured district map print with removable markers
email capture postcard mockups and a social photo‑op sample board
case_studies.lighting: Polished editorial top light with controlled highlights on paper textures, broad negative space framing the planning elements.
case_studies.mood: Tactical, energetic, time‑boxed execution with a focus on measurable KPIs.
case_studies.alt: Overhead 45° shot of a field operator and studio events lead planning a pop‑up: a textured district map with removable markers, cardboard pop‑up footprints and email capture postcard mockups lie on the table under polished editorial lighting, implying a 10–14 day co‑branded activation measured for conversion and social impact.
